website_summaries.verdict: Customers wanting a no-nonsense, reasonably priced dog house should check out this highly-rated option.
pros: Available in either red or white
Barn shape offers weather protection for your pup
Sizes available for small, medium, and large dogs
cons: Dimensions appear incorrect as stated on website

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for your cat!
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday I bought this dog house for my 16 year old cat (she only weighs about 8 Ibs), and she absolutely loves it! I put it in my garage to provide her extra warmth whenever she wants to go outside during the cold winter months (we live in Georgia). This little dog house is very durable, well insulated, easy to put together, and super easy to clean. Best of all, it is the perfect size for my cat! She immediately went right in the second I put it in my garage, and she hasn’t left it ever since! She even prefers sleeping in her new dog house over sleeping indoors with us. WOW! A++++
customer_reviews.author: M. Rabek

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Shelter for (Previously Feral) Outdoor Cat
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was that with the rain and wind we get here on the Oregon coast, some water leaks in where the red roof and black house meet. To remedy that, I inserted the entire house into a 30-gallon trash bag and cinched the handle-tie so the opening was the same size as the door opening. To keep rain out of the door, I set the house under the eaves of our house and angle it toward the house. PS. I found a swinging door at our local pet store, that fits this house exactly--and is VERY easily inserted into the opening--but the cat didn't care for it and would no longer enter! (Oh, well.)
customer_reviews.author: Jan Radclyffe

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and spacious dog house for the price. My 75 black lab has plenty of room in it and loves it. My only compliant is how bulky it is but it wouldn't be as spacious if it wasn't bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Derik Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Product description is wildly exaggerated
customer_reviews.text: "Featuring a rear air ventilation system to promote air circulation" - seriously? Two horizontal slots in the back. "raised interior flooring" - no there isn't; the floor is the bottom of the box "Improved insulation helps to keep your dog warm" - what insulation? It's a plastic box And the slots that connect the top to the bottom are a joke; they don't even fit together.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Mosley

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on my covered front porch for a feral cat. Big enough to put plenty of straw for the coming cold weather and he's already moved in. I put thick cardboard between the porch floor and the bottom of the house. I then took plastic and "wrapped" it to break the wind. I would have given it 5 stars BUT the snaps didn't line up and therefore the 4 rating. Don't let this stop you - I drilled a hole on either side and "zip-tied" the two sections - works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Cissy

customer_reviews.title: Used it for cat house - our cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I’ll speak for the cat. She stays dry during heavy rain. Stayed warm in cold. Deep enough for her to nap and feel secure. And for me - Easy to put together. Nice looking in deck. Weather proof.....well I guess that one is coming from the cat. Hhhhmm what else.....ok we’ll it seems like it will last a long time. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Plantagarden

customer_reviews.title: Great little dog house.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Chihuahua who unfortunately has to stay outside in a pen because she is very mean. She loves this little dog house and spends a lot of time in it. I put a piece of carpet in the bottom and also bought the body heater to put in it along with her blanket. I put this in a gazebo and placed stepping stones under the dog house to get it up off the ground and covered the blocks with carpeting too, too help insulate the bottom so I don't know how weather proof it really is since the gazebo prevents it from getting wet when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: AzGrannie3

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shelter for Stray Cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my stray cat. I insulated it with relectix polystyrene insulation and flipped the roof of the house which lined up perfectly. This will allow the cat and Escape door in the back. Took strips of insulation and installed it where the two pieces are attached to prevent water getting inside. The house is very sturdy I will be placing it on bricks to lift it up and keep water out for the cats. I absolutely love it and I'm confident that they will be warm in the winter. Love this one I may get another for the backyard as well. Definitely worth the money for very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Great little dog house
customer_reviews.text: We needed a small dog house for our rat terrier. This was perfect. We have a large dog and she could not get in his house with him so we looked for one he could not fit in that would be the perfect size for Daisy the rat terrier. This is just right. Now she has her own and she uses it too. They are not outside all the time but sometimes if we go out and they are outside they have their houses to get in if they want. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality and workmanship!! Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality! and workmanship!! Very durable with a nice tight fitting lid. I wrapped it with mylar blankets using duct tape and bubble wrap to make a flap lid. The little stray kitty took right to it and now sleeps in it on cold rainy nights. I plan to add a couple more around our back yard. Thank you for the Amazing price for this item. Quite unbelievable how durable it is in person. Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor pets
customer_reviews.text: IT’S PERFECT! I recently moved to a small town where I was immediately adopted by three stray cats. I’m an animal lover and although I couldn’t take them inside (I already have two cats and three dogs), I wanted to provide some kind of shelter for the winter. (How do they know?! Lol) I added a Self warming cat bed that fit inside perfectly, and as soon as I set them up my new kitties checked them out and in short order were sleeping in them. I considered buying the fancier heated outdoor houses but I think I made the best choice. The Petmate Barnhome 3 was half the price and exactly what I needed. I’m happy!
customer_reviews.author: Wally Wells

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy protection for feral neighborhood kitties
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in seconds. I bought the extra small and it's easily roomy enough for my 20 lb cat. Made of thick molded plastic that seems that it will withstand the elements for a good long time. I'll probably take the advice of the other reviewers when it really gets stormy and cover it with a plastic lawn bag, but it's got enough of a lip over the opening to do a decent job of protecting from the elements. I put mine up on my porch and turned it sideways to keep the rain out and filled it with blankets for extra added warmth. Hope they like it!
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weather/wind-proof house
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for the neighborhood stray cat. She was left behind by some other owners and we all kindof look after her. We noticed that she would curl up against our front door when it was raining or windy and figured she didn't have a place to keep out of the weather. This small dog house has been purr-fect for her. We set it up with a down blanket inside and she's in it every morning - must like it! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Wadito

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Petmate dog houses to protect the three feral cats that I feed on my uncovered porch from the elements of the New York weather. Since the rain was penetrating through the doorway, I blocked the bottom part with a 24" piece of plastic runner folded in two, which I stuck to the inside of the house with duck tape. In addition, I cut a foam placemat in two pieces and fastened the latter to the roof guard rims using sturdy bag clips. Voilà! The cats' comfortable bedding inside both houses now stays dry for the most part. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this to be such a heavy, substantial dog house. Many other reviews state that it's very durable but, I was still surprised. So far my dog has zero interest in it but, it's also his first outdoor dog house. Well worth the money, at the time of review it is $35.00.
customer_reviews.author: S.V.H.

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: It will do the job I want it to do with some rigging from my husband. The sides were totally measured wrong and therefore do not clip into place (see attached pictures—when top is even, the “clips” only meet with the sides but do not actually attach). My husband will screw the sides together. It is certainly not insulated. It’s basically really thick plastic. I’m going to add a heating pad and some blankets to make it warm enough for the cats outside. With some extra rigging from us, it will serve the purpose it’s supposed to. But I don’t exactly recommend this product 🤷🏽‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor kitties!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 extra small sizes to house two semi-feral cat siblings that we've been feeding since they were a couple months old (almost 2 yrs old now). We put them on pavers to raise them up a bit as rain still splashes up inside during hard downpours in the South. We lined them with a bath towel folded up for cushioning, and another that we folded to shape a U around the sides and back, and added a self-healing mat, and both cats love them! We're thrilled they use them every night!
customer_reviews.author: SusieHomeMaker

customer_reviews.title: Does not divert rain
customer_reviews.text: If I can give 0 stars I would. It says it diverts rain, it’s a lie. I happen to be away for the day when I got back home I check on my poor dog. There was water inside at least 3 inches of rain in there. This think does not work. To bad I pass my return date or if only it would of rain sooner to know this dog house does not divert water.
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these houses 3 years ago. 3 whole years ago! 3 years of changing seasons extremely hot and extremely cold. For the past 2 years these houses have been under shelter but still outdoors. I pack them with shavings during the winter and leave them empty during the summer. Great for my chihuahua, terrier, and dachshund. They have absolutely no wear and tear after all these years and hose off easily when the dogs have tracked dirt or rain has splashed mud on them. I would definitely recommend this purchase. We’ve gotten more than our money’s worth out of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: The houses are sturdy, waterproof, and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 stray cats that a neighbor put out last year. So I started feeding them and now they live in my yard. I purchased the houses for them because I couldn't see them out in the cold. I also purchased cat beds and put them in the houses so they would be comfortable. I also caught them and had them fixed so they could not produce an unmwanted litter. It has worked out very well.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product @ a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I feed a few stray cats that pass thru my yard and needed to replace the old 'Home'. I was looking for something to protect them from the elements while they eat and to keep the food from getting wet and soggy, of course. This product is ideal for the use I purchased it for. I placed a concrete slab underneath it to keep heavy rain and snow from entering, and also have a concrete slab on both sides to keep very windy conditions at bay. The shipping was very fast and the price was the best price I found on the Net.
customer_reviews.author: JJP4MMA

customer_reviews.title: Dog House - Good Use
customer_reviews.text: Returned not because of features, dog house but my end use needs. Looking for a feral cat shelter to weather NE winter conditions. Dog house could not be readily adapted to meet needs, e.g., dual entry/exit. One buyer for a similar use rotated top and bottom pieces but entry/exit points not weather shielded and bottom point would not keep out rain and water.
customer_reviews.author: chw

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like about this dog house?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Petmate Barn Home for an outdoor cat. It arrived well packaged and was easy to put together. None of the tabs were broken, as some reviewers said. There is a vent in the top back of the house for ventilation during warmer months, but I have blocked it off for use when it's cold. The house is in a covered shelter, so it won't really be exposed to the elements much. It seems to be a well-made product.
customer_reviews.author: MASK

customer_reviews.title: great overhang, great colors
customer_reviews.text: Very good color (darks blend with dirt better), love the big roof overhang. I simply wish that the opening was higher because it rains a LOT of in the Pacific NW and it's realistic that the ground could get soaked or splatter into the entrance. I'm using this for a cat who just got booted outdoors (he wouldn't stop peeing inside). I'm offering multiple cat house options & locations and will give away the one(s) he doesn't prefer. I got XS which is a nice size for a cat (and, of course, included a pet bed inside). It won't be highly insulated for the pit of winter, but will likely be a good option for warmer spring/ summer/ autumn days.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but I made my own door with carpet and zip ties. I can't understand ordering the door that is made for it when it cost half what the dog house cost and only comes with little s hooks instead of hardware. No easy would that hold up in my climate. The dog house is great though, stays very warm and dry, and I was easily able to make the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you actually need "weatherproof" as described, don't bother!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a feral cat mom who brought her two newborn kittens to our patio for shelter and safety. We had a brief rain and I looked out to see her taking her kittens out! When I looked in the tiny kittens were sitting in over an inch of water!!! I had to rig something else for them. Ridiculous for the price!
customer_reviews.author: D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great for my outdoor cat!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others in the review, I bought this for an outdoor cat and lined it with insulation. I also assembled it backwards so the cat has a front and rear entrance. She loves it! It keeps her warm and dry, and she even likes laying on top of it. I'm very pleased that I have a safe place for my cat to stay.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than stated
customer_reviews.text: size: 25-50LBS. Seems well made, but smaller than stated. There was no way to get a 32 inch length measurement. It was maybe 30 inches to the lip of the door by 25 wide at the seam. The floor dimension was only 24 x 21 inches, and not big enough for a 40 pound spaniel. The photo showing a Springer Spaniel in the doorway must be of a really small Springer. I'm sending this one back and trying again with the larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Allen

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Charlie the dog hates it
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Charlie the dog hates it. The only reason he goes in it at all is to retrieve a cookie I throw in as bate or to pull out the pad. I tried taking the lid off and putting it in the shed for shelter from storms. He doesn't like the shed either. I kept thinking he'd get desperate and go it and use it - nope. Good house. Naughty dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy dog house works for our Husky pups!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and seemed to be quite insulated and our dogs love them. I bought two of these one for each of our Husky's and they will get into them with no problem. They also like standing on them and unlike some of the boxes in the past these ones do not bend out of shape or collapse due to their weight. They are very durable and so far I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: starsandtrains

customer_reviews.title: Not great in a storm.
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and easy to put together. However, it does not protect the dog during a storm. It would need to be under a porch. The rain came in. Also in a strong wind the top blew right off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Changing this review from a 4 to a 3. It's ok, but the top doesn't stay snapped to the bottom very well, and therefore does leak if it really rains hard. Also gets hot inside very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lori S

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the stray cat I've adopted. I was worried it would be too large but it's perfect for putting Reflectix and straw in with room for the cat. It's very thick and sturdy and simply just snaps into place. I might have to give the opening a larger good for rain but otherwise, it's exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: NayaChan

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for ferral cats to use as a shelter over winter. I added a foam insert to floor along with straw. The cats use it regularly. We did have a severe windy which blew off top even though it was snapped on. I added two screws to keep top from blowing off
customer_reviews.author: Kimba3

customer_reviews.title: Great for Feral Cats.
customer_reviews.text: Great for feral cats. Highly recommend going the extra mile to insulate. See my review video. The cats love it. Sprinkle a little cat nip to lure in. If our hut was out in the weather rather than protected under our carport we would have our gorilla tape around the side seams
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great, reputable company to deal with, not a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this soley because it read that it was insulated. I have a homeless cat that I feed who lives in the backyard on my backyard furniture under tarps at night. I purchased this to line it with fleece and a foam lined fabric cat house because it gets cold at night in the winter/rainy months. It is thick plastic. Period. There is absolutely no insulation whatsoever and it is obvious when you look at. The company however was great to deal with and gave me a full refund without even making me mail it back.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our old 20 year old arthritic cat to use as his his cat house. We just went through a ton of rain & snow & he stayed dry the whole time. It’s very sturdy & he loves it!we added a floor heater & a bunch of soft blankets too. He likes this house outside better than being inside. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what my kitties needed!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my outdoor cats. I have it on a covered porch. I line the inside with a plush towel, which makes it easy to wash the towel/change it out. A stray cat who I haven't been able to capture and fix sprays the exterior but it wipes off easily with a paper towel wet with hot water/soap. So, this is highly durable for outdoor kitties, including strays. I like that they can sit upright inside it, and that it fits multiple cats for sleeping as well. I face the opening towards a wall, with enough room for them to comfortably go in and out. Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Champion

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE DOG HOUSE
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality weatherproof dog house that is very good looking and sturdy. I bought it for my barn cats and it only took one day for them to start using it. Three were in it the other day. I keep this on a covered porch and it stays dry all of the time. I buy very cheap bargain store pillows for padding and the cats love them. If a pillow gets too dirty I just put in a new one and burn the old one in the burn barrel. Little enough I can do for some great mousers. I bought this dog house on sale too so that makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Kensington8

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this. Very easy to put together. Took less than 3 minutes to assemble. I put a bed in the bottom because I use it outside and it does sit directly on the floor. My dog liked it immediately and spends a lot of time in it. Looks nice and does not seem cheaply made. I bought the separate door but never put it on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the weather elements
customer_reviews.text: Well made product! Keep it in back porch Cats love it, I put carpeted board on floor added small insulated bed and they love it ! Only thing I recommend is entrance is cut a little low to ground rain could spash in, I put a lille barrier across bottom to prevent water from coming in ! Works well !
customer_reviews.author: Mike jr

customer_reviews.title: Animal shelter approved
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for Hub City Humane Society after I saw a request for their shelter. They were very excited and grateful to get it. They said It's easy to clean, durable and the dogs find them comfortable .
customer_reviews.author: CountryMom

customer_reviews.title: We use it as a feral cat house !!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality little house. Bought it to help a little cat left at the campground this fall. Flipped the lid around like other review said , taped the vents. Viola! Recommend. Held up great and easy to clean with mild soap and hose.
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice cozy home
customer_reviews.text: Love this. This is perfect for the stray cats in my neighborhood. The other reviews suggests just latching the top opposite, so don’t have the openings lining up. This way stray cats or other animals have an entrance AND an exit. The roof is easy & sturdy to latch on. I added a brick inside because I’m nervous the bottom part might blow away.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Rawr

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said, the tabs and slots don't fit together at all. The top half basically sits on the bottom half and can be easily knocked over. Needless to say, doesn't stop rain from leaking in the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Doggy House
customer_reviews.text: Perfect doggy house for our Jack Russell Terrier. Washable, durable and perfectly sized. We keep this under a covered patio, so she's not exposed to the elements. She seems quite comfy in our year round warm climate, with the ventilation provided.
customer_reviews.author: k.momoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Chucky loves his house!
customer_reviews.text: My 90 lb. pitbull Chucky, a foster dog, loves this doghouse. I will find him outside laying in it even though he has freedom to come in thru his doggy door. I have to beg him to leave it and come sleep in the house at night, and sometimes he prefers to stay in it. It is sturdy, very very inexpensive compared to others, and extra roomy, with lots of space for air circulation. I just tossed a thin cushion into it and he loves laying in there. Best money spent in years.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie in Utah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our cats
customer_reviews.text: We bought the small version for our cats. They are indoor/outdoor and I wanted them to have a place to go if it rained or started to get cold. We typically let them in at these times, but sometimes they venture out and don’t come back at night. When we get up in the morning we see both cats pop out of the little house together. They sleep in there together at night and really seem to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Finally, our search is over!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect house for my dad's outside cat -- we've been searching since early Fall, knowing that Connecticut winters are snowy, cold and wet. We went to ALL the retail stores and kept coming up empty handed. This "Barn Home" is good looking and fits perfectly on the back porch. I bought the self warming crate pad as well, and even though it took almost two months for the cat to get used to her new shelter, it was worth the wait. She now stays in her bed through the night and even on cold days. We're ALL very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Petmate Barnhome III Dog House
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. Well made: very sturdy, heavy duty & exactly what I was looking for. I bought it for a stray cat to have a place to hide & stay dry. I will work on putting some insulation in the barnhome for this winter for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Stay Warm & Cozy

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice thick house, will stand up to elements. Purchased for neighbor's cat that likes to visit (he used it right away), nice size, big enough for him to fit inside and be able to move around, could possibly fit more than one kitty. A great addition for that outdoor cat that needs a little extra attention. The price is great. Purchased a warming mat and blankets for inside, house is on covered porch. Pleased, would purchase again. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: PrincessJS

customer_reviews.title: Not in any way weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this house for the outdoor cats, and it is in no way, shape, or form weather proof. The rain came in through the entrance and made half the house wet. This "home" is useless for keeping outdoor pets warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: petril

customer_reviews.title: Great dog houses for cold/wet weather.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my dogs. Allows them to have a confined space out of the elements. The only issue I run into is when I add the available plastic doors, the connection method is not very secure. Not exactly the fault of the dog house, but the combined efforts weren't done very well. I had to crimp the piece of metal that holds the door in place to make it stay. But otherwise the dogs are always in these things during cold weather. I added some wood shaving to the bottom to give them some added comfort.
customer_reviews.author: lostraider

customer_reviews.title: Great for my feral cats
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of wonderful feral cats that hang around. They are both a part of the feral cat community, but often stop by for a quick snack or a nap, and this little dog house is the perfect shelter for them to get out of the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get this one for your animal they will love it
customer_reviews.text: This pet house was exactly what I needed for my feral kitty Ghost. He loves it, especially when it's cold and it rains. The house is excellent quality and just the right kitty size. Ghost thanks you.
customer_reviews.author: Quantumlife

customer_reviews.title: great price thank you
customer_reviews.text: love this cute little house for my outside cat! been trying to catch the cat! wanted to take to vet and try bringing in my basement, until the cat could co exsist with my other cat. so thank you
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fit the bill
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little house for a neighborhood kitty who is outside a lot. First, shipping was so fast! Ordered it on a Sunday, by Tuesday evening it had arrived. It was super easy to put together. Just snap the top onto the bottom...done. There is no insulation in this hut so I put a smaller cardboard box lined with warm blankets INSIDE the hut itself to add a layer of protection. Kitty climbed in today, curled up for a nap and stayed warm and dry. I would not recommend this for frigid cold protection. You'd need a heating pad or just bring your pet inside.
customer_reviews.author: Rita G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my feral cats I care for. I threw away the bins and tubs i made them for the winter. It's rained and the beds inside are still dry so I guess they are water proof. I'm goin to buy a couple more since the cats like them.
customer_reviews.author: Lupeq

customer_reviews.title: Cozy home for feral cats .
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. So far , I have purchased 2 and will be purchasing more in the future. They are for some feral cats and work well keeping them out of the elements on winter days. I just fit a soft blanket inside and it's so cozy for them .
customer_reviews.author: CBS

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our large garage kitty...he loves it in the winter. We have a soft bed for him to sleep in it. He hasn't really got in it now that the weather has warmed up. Not really much air circulation in it. Really sturdy and easy to put together. Can remove the top to clean it easily. Would be great if you have an outdoor animal and could put it up or under something - like a porch or deck. Kind of light weight so I don't know how it would do in heavy wind. We have this in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and this is a great shelter for bad weather
customer_reviews.text: The outside City Kitty needs protection from the elements - we are engaged in TNR - Trap, Neuter, Release which returns feral cats to a "colony" to live out their days, and this is a great shelter for bad weather. It does not have a small opening in back to pass a cord through so I used my drill and now the cats have a heated Barnhome. The shelter is large enough for 2 adult cats; it doesn't leak and looks great - best shelter for the money by far, thanks TopDawg Pet Supply.
customer_reviews.author: PamC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this brand of cat houses for several years and have been very happy with them. They are sturdy and long lasting. They protect the feral cats from the mild winter weather and rain. I now have four of these units
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: super sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Barn Home that I've owned over the years. Mine are the smallest size and I use them for my cats, not for dogs. The product is super sturdy, yet easy to assemble. My first one was a really cute light pink/dark pink combination, but that seems to have been discontinued. My newer one is dark red and gray, just like the picture. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Studio T

customer_reviews.title: I bought 7 because they are the BEST value!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I had been waiting for. I use them for box turtle shelter. I use them for my Greek tortoise shelter. I use them for my many rabbits! These are sturdy and will last forever. So..... there you go.
customer_reviews.author: Animal Queen56

customer_reviews.title: easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Received in good condition; listing was exactly shown; easy to build (2 parts) BUT, the snaps wouldn't hold and stay when putting together (the roof kept popping out of the bottom piece.
customer_reviews.author: LEHUA NO KA OI

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have a labradoodle and she hated this. The quality is not the best either. You would think it would be waterproof but the slits on the backside often let water leak in. Would definitely not work well if you live in an area with colder environments.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and strong pet house!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great small pet house. It was shipped in a good size box and arrived in good condition / on time. Really ease to put together and just what I needed. I'm actually using it for a feral cat that hangs around my property that I feed and water. I combined this pet house with a heated pet pad and some blankets over the top of the pet house to provide a warm winter shelter for the feral cat on a covered patio. She loves her pet house.
customer_reviews.author: SW Guy

customer_reviews.title: messed up a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the PetMate houses for almost 10 years and the old ones are just now starting to deteriorate. One developed a crack in the top, so I ordered a new one. Please be advised that these new houses are NOT the size posted in the ads!!! The old ones were that size, but these are considerably smaller. ... I have these houses for the dogs to rest in when they're outside. (They sleep inside at night) but the new one is too small for an adult Sheltie to go into. ... Doskocil Mfg. messed up a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Works great for feral cats
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews and the ones that stated you can turn the top around so there is an entrance and exit I bought it. It's perfect. Very solidly built too!
customer_reviews.author: R. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Mousers Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciated the comments and advice given by other buyers for turning this into a safe house for my outdoor mousers. I put the lid on backwards to give them 2 entrances and there is plenty of room inside for an igloo style self warming bed and their food and water dishes. I haven't yet added any insulation or taped up the vents - just waiting to see how cold it gets this winter.
customer_reviews.author: ELP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my two little dogs !
customer_reviews.text: Its great , perdect size for my two little dogs and a got ut used from amazon wherehouse 37 dlls plus tax and looks brand new a great Deal !!
customer_reviews.author: LILIANA

customer_reviews.title: My ferral cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The outdoor cat I am taming loves this, and it really is keeping her dry today. I was so happy to see she moved right in and know this is her home, and that it keeps her warm and dry. This was very easy to assemble. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Winston

customer_reviews.title: Actual size is smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Its is not size it states. Much smaller. Bought this in past. Size on house (inches) is incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: D. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great winter house for stray cats
customer_reviews.text: Love these pet barns. We have two neighborhood strays who use them all the tine.. I purchased heating pads to fit each one and the kitties are nice and cozy during our sometimes nasty Ohio winters.
customer_reviews.author: amreink

customer_reviews.title: Great for a cat/ modified
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a cat. We turned the top part around and put it on backwards so the cat could get in or out on either side and it worked perfect. We added a heating mat the cat loved it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for feral cat colony use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these for a feral cat colony I have. They are using them with straw inside. They are using them and happy they are out of the elements 0f weather.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA ACKERLY

customer_reviews.title: If the plan is to use it inside a building that is warm and dry it's Perfect. Spend the extra money on the igloo for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for its price and the fact that it had a plastic flap for a door. It is made of extremely thick plastic not insulated at all and has vents on the back for air circulation. I have invested a bit of money in this barnhome to make it suitable for extreme cold weather and rain. Basically if the purpose is to put this barnhome out in the elements on its own it Does not Qualify!! If the plan is to use it inside a building that is warm and dry it's Perfect. Spend the extra money on the igloo for outside elements.
customer_reviews.author: James P

customer_reviews.title: Served its purpose for shelter for feral cat
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a feral cat to use in northeast winters...reversed top and bottom to give a little more security and closed off bottom open section with thick piece of insulation board. Old dog bed on inside with newspaper lining. ( Placed off ground) . Cat loved it and stayed inside all winter. Too warm for summer as the cat layed on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: kristie

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and construction
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality and construction. I probably could have gotten by with a MEDIUM, but I wanted to make sure my dog - 52 pounds - would have enough room. After opening the shipping box and pulling the parts out, I was worried when I did not see any fasteners or instructions. Looking for a place to set the top half of the doghouse down, I put it on the bottom half of the doghouse. Hearing a "click", I realized the top and bottom simply snap together. These connections seem very secure. Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Great little shelter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog house for a stray cat that I'm always feeding. Its the perfect size for protection from the elements and keeps him warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: This Barn Home is very sturdy. It comes packaged as nested pieces
customer_reviews.text: This Barn Home is very sturdy. It comes packaged as nested pieces. It was a little hard to get them apart but then after that they just snap together. I haven't actually snapped it together yet because we're using it to cover an outdoor generator for protection when it rains and will probably just keep the sections separate for ease in moving. It has vents out the back and I especially like the little roof type affect in the front to prevent light rain from entering the box.
customer_reviews.author: GetRDone

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little dog house
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little dog house. I initially bought it because we had a stray cat hanging around but she ended up not using it so I brought it inside for my in-laws Pomeranian and Chihuahua to use. The pom will hide in it occasionally but that's about it. It is very nice though. It is just also very dark and I don't think they like that. It would be great outside but we don't leave our dogs outside.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Kitty approved
customer_reviews.text: We've been adopted by a stray kitty and since we already have three indoor cats we must leave this one outside. Nights can get cold and we can have wicked rain fronts. It is a nice size for a cat, she is in it everytime we get really cold or it is raining hard. It is a bit thicker than a kitty litter box, but in really cold climate you might want to put a tarp over it for added protection.
customer_reviews.author: MomE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little house, especially for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I LOVED that it took less than 2 minutes to assemble and I love that it seems to be made really well and sturdy, plus it's cute and the cat and the dog both love it! Excellent value for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Zawadzki

customer_reviews.title: Larger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 16+ pound black cat. He loves to sleep in his carrier so I wanted something that he would like and keep him dry and warm. I purhased this with a bed that I could put in for comfort. He seemed to enjoy the box it came in very well but did come and take a quick peek at his new house. I will get it set up with his smells for him to feel comfortable. I will have to drill 2 holes to secure the top to the base. Doesnt snap together as I would hope, but 2 bolts and lock nuts and washers should do the trick. Seems nicely built.
customer_reviews.author: catfvr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful! This is the second I've bought. I take care of stray cats and have two of these on my porch with heating pads in them. This has kept my stray kitties warm and dry. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: mmr859

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have this available for a stray cat that wanders thru every now and then for food. When it is raining he stays in it until I get home and can feed him.
customer_reviews.author: Tmcdonell

customer_reviews.title: Great for an outdoor cat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a stray cat that has been living under our car. We put this outside with a towel on the floor of the house. Pros: - Lightweight - Easy to snap together - It rained one night and when I checked on the house the next morning, everything inside seemed dry except for right at the entrance. Cons: - The bottom of the entrance is a bit low so rain was able to splash up into the house. We've only had this outside for a few weeks and it' been pretty warm. Will update this review once winter sets in to see how it holds up to winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: JT Riley

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Plastic overfilled the clip that holds the two pieces together causing the two pieces not to lock together
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Collins

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my ferals, but I haven't ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ferals, but I haven't put it outside yet as they have enough shelter right now. This is very roomy and I say could fit 2-3 cats, if they wanted to be together. Wide entryway might be a problem in the rain/snow, but I'll worry about that when I put it outside. It is in my apartment now, and my indoor cats are enjoying it for the time being!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Strakna

customer_reviews.title: Be careful to look close and read lbs it will hold
customer_reviews.text: I ordered wrong size put will use on baby puppy pen looks good durable .. wish I had gotten size I wanted 15 lbs up not down
customer_reviews.author: Barking Baby 4 U

customer_reviews.title: Great pet house for outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used which stated in Good Condition. I was wonderfully surprised since it looked brand new. I keep it on my back porch for when my cat goes outside. She loves it along with a new warm bed I put inside.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Reeder

customer_reviews.title: It'll Work
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend buying the clear rubber door that hangs in the door way of this dog house. Especially if you plan to use this outside. Mine seems to get water inside every time it rains, which kinda defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Broussard

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Too bad my dog is a moron ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a replacement because the first one I got was damaged. That's why I reduced my rating by a star. Although it's the shipping company's fault the item was damaged, the lack of packaging was also to blame. Other than that, I like it. Too bad my dog is a moron and stands right next to it in the rain looking pitiful and feeling sorry for itself instead of seeking the shelter within! I'm working on that...
customer_reviews.author: stream

customer_reviews.title: For the ferals
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I got this for the feral cats who live in my yard. There are currently 2 medium cats sharing & loving it, but I can see how it would be fine for 3 who liked to snuggle. I haven't had any rain issues so far, but this will go under something to protect it from snow, so I'm not too worried. Top lifts off with ease so that you can fill with straw & clean easily.
customer_reviews.author: Miss 60

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: The construction is heavy plastic but not very dimensionally stable, so the top may not snap onto the bottom properly. We tried two of these and had issues with both. Personally, if I had a dog small enough to use this I wouldn't leave it out, but that's just me (I used it for ducks).
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter, sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: This dog shelter is sturdy and solid. Good size for a dog up to at least 30 lbs. Fits together easily and stays together. I can think of no cons at all. Yes, in very cold weather one would want to provide warm 'nesting' materials inside . I got it for short term shelter in case a cat got left outside or was waiting to come inside in inclement weather, but not to live in. Dogs do not belong living outside ever.
customer_reviews.author: BBB

customer_reviews.title: It makes a terrific kitty house
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a kitty house and realized the only difference between a dog house and a cat house is that cats want an escape route out of the house. The ones made for cats were way too expensive. My husband got the great idea of using a saw to cut an exit out of the back side of the house the same size as the front side. My cats loved it so much I bought a second one so they wouldn't try to fit both of their bodies into one. They are the perfect size for a cat!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen C.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HOUSE FOR CATS!
customer_reviews.text: This house is great for the outdoors on our front porch! The neighborhood cat who has "adopted" us loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Verbatim

customer_reviews.title: Very great house just needs warm insulation.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my indoor/outdoor cat and at first she didn’t use it. I got a soft fleece blanket and let her use it inside and then put it inside and put her food next to it and she started using the house. I put an old pillow inside for her as well so it’s got plenty of room for things inside. It just not very warm inside so I’m going to be adding more insulation to it.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

product_meta.title: Petmate Barnhome III Dog House
product_meta.description: Size:Up to 15lbs| Color:Red/BlackThe Petmate Barn home 3 is a barn-shaped dog house that protects your dog from the outdoor elements. Featuring rear air ventilation to promote air circulation, an extended roof guard rim to divert rain and raised interior flooring to help keep your pet dry. Plastic dog homes never need painting and are rot and mold resistant. Two-piece snap together assembly. Available in a variety of sizes and colors. Made in the USA. NOTE: The ventilation system is not actually air conditioning but rather slots that provide air flow for the pet
feature_bullets: Outdoor Dog House: This heavy duty barn style dog home features rear air ventilation & an extended roof guard for fresh air flow, weather protection & to keep pets dry. Accommodates pets up to 15 lbs.
Easy Assembly: The durable pet house is made of plastic with a mold-resistant finish and comes in two pieces that easily snap together. The outdoor pet house is also perfect for feral cats & strays.
Kennels & Houses: Crate & kennel training is vital for dog safety & comfort. We provide traditional travel carriers, wire training & exercise kennels, play pens, barn-style dog houses & more.

Petmate: For over 50 years, we at Petmate are passionate about our dogs, cats & furry friends in general. Starting with the very first dog kennel, we've produced plenty of eco-friendly products that pets will love.

Just For Pets: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
